title: Cell segmentation proposal network for microscopy image analysis
summary: Convolutional neural network for cell detection and segmentation

title: Microscopy cell segmentation via adversarial neural networks
summary: Generative adversarial neural network (GAN) for cell segmentation with limited amount of annotated data

title: HTX: a tool for the exploration and visualization of high-throughput image assays
summary: HTX, an interactive tool to aid in the exploration of large microscopy data sets by allowing the visualization of entire image-based assays according to visual similarities between the  samples

title: Automated Gleason grading of prostate cancer tissue microarrays via deep learning
summary: Convolutional neural network for autometed Gleason grading of prostate cancer tissue microarrays with Hematoxylin and Eosin (H&E) staining.

title: Deep learning-based detection of motion artifacts in probe-based confocal laser endomicroscopy images
summary: automatic detection of motion artifacts in pCLE images

title: Context-Aware Learning Using Transferable Features for Classification of Breast Cancer Histology Images
summary: Classification of breast cancer Whole Slide Images that combines activation features of a CNN trained for patch-based classification, to train a separate classifier for image based classification. The classfier uses extracted CNN features from overlapping image patches to perform image-based classification.

title: Denoising of short exposure transmission electron microscopy images for ultrastructural enhancement
summary: Deep convolutional neural network based approaches to de-noise short exposure high-resolution TEM images of cilia

title: Comparison of segmentation methods for tissue microscopy images of glioblastoma cells
summary: Comparison of segmentation methods, including a novel deep neural network based on atrous spatial pyramid pooling (ASPP), for cell nuclei segmentation in tissue microscopy images of glioblastoma cells.

title: Context-aware stacked convolutional neural networks for classification of breast carcinomas in whole-slide histopathology images
summary: Context-aware stacked CNNs are designed first training a CNN using high pixel resolution to capture cellular level information and then fed the feature responses generated as input to a second CNN, stacked on top of the first. Training of this stacked architecture with large input patches enables learning of fine-grained (cellular) details and global tissue structures.

title: Roto-Translation Covariant Convolutional Networks for Medical Image Analysis
summary: three different problems in histopathology, retinal imaging, and electron microscopy that with the proposed group CNNs, state-ofthe-art performance can be achieved, without the need for data augmentation by rotation and with increased performance compared to standard CNNs that do rely on augmentation

title: Multi-loss convolutional networks for gland analysis in microscopy
summary: CNN for automatic tissue analysis as the joint task of segmentation and classification. Novel multi-objective learning method that optimizes a single unified deep fully convolutional neural network with two distinct loss functions.

title: DeepLoco: Fast 3D Localization Microscopy Using Neural Networks
summary: CNN for estimating the number and locations of fluorophores in a single frame in Single-molecule localization super-resolution microscopy. The presented algorithm can analyze a 20000-frame experimental 3D SMLM dataset in about one second - substantially faster than real-time and existing algorithms.

title: A Multiresolution Convolutional Neural Network with Partial Label Training for Annotating Reflectance Confocal Microscopy Images of Skin
summary: annotate morphological patterns in reflectance confocal microscopy

title: Delineation of Skin Strata in Reflectance Confocal Microscopy Images with Recurrent Convolutional Networks
summary: deep recurrent convolutional neural networks to delineate skin strata in stacks of RCM images collected at consecutive depths

title: Prospective identification of hematopoietic lineage choice by deep learning
summary: deep neural network that predicts lineage choice in differentiating primary hematopoietic progenitor cells using image patches from brightfield microscopy and cellular movement

title: Deep Learning Improves Template Matching by Normalized Cross Correlation
summary: improve the robustness of template matching by preprocessing images with "siamese" convolutional networks trained to maximize the contrast between NCC values of true and false matches

title: Deep learning based tissue analysis predicts outcome in colorectal cancer
summary: Convolutional and recurrent architectures to train a deep network to predict colorectal cancer patient outcome based on images of tumour tissue samples.

title: Weakly supervised learning of single-cell feature embeddings
summary: CNN trained based on a weakly supervised approach for single-cell feature embedding. Replicates of the same treatment condition are used as labels for learning discriminat features to investigate treatment similarities in a downstream analysis.

title: Evaluation of Deep Learning Strategies for Nucleus Segmentation in Fluorescence Images
summary: Release of a set of 23,165 manually annotated nuclei and source code to reproduce experiments. Evaluation of two deep learning strategies (U-Net and DeepCell) and classical aprroach implemented in CellProfiler. U-Net outperforms both DeepCells and classical algorithms

title: Deep Convolutional Neural Network Analysis of Flow Imaging Microscopy Data to Classify Subvisible Particles in Protein Formulations
summary: CNN for morphological features extraction of particles in therapeutic protein formulations using flow-imaging miscroscopy

title: Terabyte-scale Deep Multiple Instance Learning for Classification and Localization in Pathology
summary: 12,000 WSI from prostate needle biopsies used to propose a Deep Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) framework where only the whole slide class is used to train a convolutional neural network capable of classifying digital slides on a large scale.

title: A hybrid Cnn-Rf method for electron microscopy images segmentation
summary: Automated segmentation of neuronal structures for 3d reconstruction of brain tissue from EM images based on an hybrid CNN and Random Forset classifier combination.

title: Weakly-supervised structured output learning with flexible and latent graphs using high-order loss functions
summary: Two new structured output models for estimation of the number and proportion of classes of microcirculatory supply units (MCSU). The two models use a latent graph, which is flexible in terms of the number of nodes and structure, where the training process minimises a high-order loss function using a weakly annotated training set

title: Automatic Quantification of Tumour Hypoxia from Multi-Modal Microscopy Images Using Weakly-Supervised Learning Methods
summary: Measuring tumor hypoxia with four different methadologies based on weakly-supevied machine learning, latent structured output learning and deep learning models.

title: Segmentation of actin-stained 3D fluorescent cells with filopodial protrusions using convolutional neural networks
summary: Convolutional neural network (CNN) designed for the segmentation of actin-stained cells in 3D+t confocal microscopy image data

title: A fast CLSM undersampling image reconstruction framework with precise stage positioning for random measurements
summary: Non-iteration-based deep residual convolutional neural network compressive sensing reconstruction framework for confocal laser scanning microscopy

title: Human induced pluripotent stem cell region recognition in microscopy images using Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: A deep learning architecture Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for automatic classification and recognition of reprogramming and reprogrammed human Induced Pluripotent Stem (iPS) cell regions in microscopy images.

title: Deep Learning in Label-free Cell Classification
summary: Integrate feature extraction and deep learning with high-throughput quantitative imaging enabled by photonic time stretch, achieving record high accuracy in label-free cell classification for personalized genomics, cancer diagnostics, and drug development

title: Neuron segmentation using deep complete bipartite networks
summary: Automatic segmentation of neuronal cells in dual-color confocal microscopy images using a deep complete bipartite networks (CB-Net), and a new scheme for leveraging approximate instance-wise annotation to train a pixel-wise prediction model.

title: Deep-learning-assisted Volume Visualization
summary: Volume visualizations based on the high-dimensional deep features spectral methods to facilitate user interactions with high-dimensional features and a new deep-learning-assisted technique for hierarchically exploring a volumetric dataset.

title: Volume segmentation using convolutional neural networks with limited training data
summary: 3D CNN that uses both factorized convolutions and online feature-level augmentations for volume segmentation

title: A computational study on convolutional feature combination strategies for grade classification in colon cancer using fluorescence microscopy data
summary: The cancer diagnostic workflow for grade classification in colon cancer based on CNN features extraction and linear SVM for data classification.

title: Blood vessel characterization using virtual 3D models and convolutional neural networks in fluorescence microscopy
summary: Automated method for characterization of microvessel morphology in micrographs of brain tissue sections to enable the facile, quantitative analysis of vascular differences across large datasets

title: Active deep learning reduces annotation burden in automatic cell segmentation
summary: Cell segmentation with CNN using active learning to reduce annotation burden

title: In Silico Labeling: Predicting Fluorescent Labels in Unlabeled Images
summary: In silico labeling” (ISL) uses deep neural network to reliably predicts a different of fluorescent labels from transmitted-light images of unlabeled fixed or live biological samples without the limitation of spectral overlap.

title: 3D U-Net: Learning Dense Volumetric Segmentation from Sparse Annotation
summary: Neural network for volumetric segmentation that learns from sparsely annotated volumetric images. In a semi-automated setup, the user annotates some slices in the volume to be segmented. The network learns from these sparse annotations and provides a dense 3D segmentation. In a fully-automated setup, we assume that a representative, sparsely annotated training set exists.

title: Mitosis Detection in Breast Cancer Histology Images with Deep Neural Networks
summary: Deep max-pooling convolutional neural networks to detect mitosis in breast histology images.

title: Deep Neural Networks Segment Neuronal Membranes in Electron Microscopy Images
summary: Automatic segmentation of neuronal structures depicted in stacks of electron microscopy (EM) images to map 3D brain structures and connectivity depicted in stacks of electron microscopy images.

title: Deep learning image recognition enables efficient genome editing in zebrafish by automated injections
summary: Deep learning software that allows for microinjection at a trained target site in zebrafish eggs at unprecedented speed

title: Classification and Mutation Prediction from Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Histopathology Images using Deep Learning
summary: Deep learning convolutional neural network (CNN) model (inception v3) on histopathology images obtained from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) to accurately classify whole-slide pathology images into adenocarcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma or normal lung tissue. Furthermore, the network can predict the ten most commonly mutated genes in lung adenocarcinoma.

title: High-throughput adaptive sampling for whole-slide histopathology image analysis (HASHI) via convolutional neural networks: Application to invasive breast cancer detection
summary: HASHI involves the combination of a new efficient adaptive sampling method and a powerful representation learning classifier based on CNNs for precise detection of invasive breast cancer on whole-slide images (WSI)

title: Accurate and reproducible invasive breast cancer detection in whole-slide images: A Deep Learning approach for quantifying tumor extent
summary: a new method that employs a convolutional neural network to automatically identify the extent of invasive tumor on digitized images, that involves training the classifier on nearly 400 exemplars from multiple different sites, and scanners, and then independently validating on almost 200 cases from The Cancer Genome Atlas.

title: Automated microscopy and machine learning for expert-level malaria field diagnosis
summary: Low-cost automated digital microscope coupled with a set of computer vision and classification algorithms, which can accurately diagnose of a variety of infectious diseases, targeting use-cases in the developing world

title: Analysis of Convolutional Neural Networks and Shape Features for Detection and Identification of Malaria Parasites on Thin Blood Smears
summary: Comparison and implementation of models using convolutional neural networks, and a model using extracted shape features for malaria diagnosis in remote areas.

title: Rich feature hierarchies for cell detecting under phase contrast microscopy images
summary: Modified region-convolutional neural network to detect cells under phase contrast microscopy images by adopting multiple object-proposal-generations instead of a single one to extract candidate regions.

title: Using machine-learning to optimize phase contrast in a low-cost cellphone microscope
summary: Convolutional neural network (CNN) for learning a relationship between samples to be examined and its optimal light source shapes, in order to increase e.g. phase contrast, from a given dataset to enable real-time applications in a low-cost cellphone microscope

title: Label-free assessment of red blood cell storage lesions by deep learning
summary: Label-free imaging flow cytometry and deep learning that can characterize red blood cells morphologies, replacing the current practice of manually quantifying a blood smear from stored blood units.

title: Deep learning for automatic cell detection in wide-field microscopy zebrafish images
summary: A unique framework is proposed for automatically detecting Tyrosine Hydroxylase-containing (TH-labeled) cells in larval zebrafish brain z-stack images recorded through the wide-field microscope.

title: Automated synaptic connectivity inference for volume electron microscopy
summary: SyConn framework, deep convolutional neural networks and random forest classifiers to infer a richly annotated synaptic connectivity matrix from manual neurite skeleton reconstructions by automatically identifying mitochondria, synapses and their types, axons, dendrites, spines, myelin, somata and cell types.

title: Learning normalized inputs for iterative estimation in medical image segmentation
summary: Pipeline for medical image segmentation that combines Fully Convolutional Networks (FCNs) with Fully Convolutional Residual Networks (FC-ResNets).

title: Overlapping cell nuclei segmentation in microscopic images using deep belief networks
summary: Method for segmentation of nuclei of single/isolated and overlapping/touching immature white blood cells from microscopic images of B-Lineage acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) prepared from peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirate.

title: Very Deep Convolutional Neural Networks for Morphologic Classification of Erythrocytes
summary: Evaluating the performance of leading implementation strategies for convolutional neural networks (CNNs) when applied to classification of erythrocytes based on morphology

title: Single-Cell Phenotype Classification Using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: The potential of deep learning methods to high-content screening–based phenotype classification.

title: Using deep convolutional neural networks to identify and classify tumor-associated stroma in diagnostic breast biopsies
summary: Machine learning techniques to digital images of hematoxylin and eosin stained tissue sections of benign and malignant image-guided breast biopsies performed to investigate mammographic abnormalities

title: Reconstructing cell cycle and disease progression using deep learning
summary: We show that deep convolutional neural networks combined with non-linear dimension reduction enable reconstructing biological processes based on raw image data

title: Segmentation of corneal endothelium images using a U-Net-based convolutional neural network
summary: Diagnostic information regarding the health status of the corneal endothelium may be obtained by analyzing the size and the shape of the endothelial cells in specular microscopy images.

title: Residual Deconvolutional Networks for Brain Electron Microscopy Image Segmentation
summary: Residual deconvolutional network consists of two information pathways that capture full-resolution features and contextual information, respectively

title: Global probabilistic models for enhancing segmentation with convolutional networks
summary: Combine convolutional network based segmentation approaches with a global probabilistic model that effectively enforces prior shape constraints for cell segmentation

title: Implementation of Regional-CNN and SSD Machine Learning Object Detection Architectures for the Real Time Analysis of Blood Borne Pathogens in Dark Field Microscopy
summary: Investigates the disparities between Tensorflow object detection APIs, exclusively, Single Shot Detector (SSD) Mobilenet V1 and the Faster RCNN Inception V2 model

title: Three-dimensional visualization and a deep-learning model reveal complex fungal parasite networks in behaviorally manipulated ants
summary: We examine adaptations of a microbial parasite in its natural environment: the body of its coevolved and manipulated host

title: Three Dimensional Fluorescence Microscopy Image Synthesis and Segmentation
summary: nuclei segmentation method using synthetic 3D volumes for training

title: Nuclei segmentation of fluorescence microscopy images using convolutional neural networks
summary: nuclei segmentation method using a deep convolutional neural network, data augmentation to generate training images of different shapes and contrasts, a refinement process combining segmentation results of horizontal, frontal, and sagittal planes in a volume, and a watershed technique to count the number of nuclei

title: Large Scale Image Segmentation with Structured Loss based Deep Learning for Connectome Reconstruction
summary: 3D U-net, trained to predict affinities between voxels, followed by iterative region agglomeration

title: Candy Cane: Breast Cancer Pixel-Wise Labeling with Fully Convolutional Densenets
summary: Candy Cane, a system for performing pixel-wise labelling of whole-slide images in four classes: normal tissue, benign lesion, in situ carcinoma and invasive carcinoma is introduced

title: Detection and classification of cancer in whole slide breast histopathology images using deep convolutional networks
summary: We present a system that classifies whole slide images (WSI) of breast biopsies into five diagnostic categories

title: A multi-scale convolutional neural network for phenotyping high-content cellular images
summary: An approach based on a multi-scale convolutional neural network (M-CNN) that classifies, in a single cohesive step, cellular images into phenotypes by using directly and solely the images’ pixel intensity values

title: CytoGAN: Generative Modeling of Cell Images
summary: Application of Generative Adversarial Networks to the domain of morphological profiling of human cultured cells imaged by fluorescence microscopy.

title: Deep profiling of mouse splenic architecture with CODEX multiplexed imaging.
summary: An algorithmic pipeline for single-cell antigen quantification in tightly packed tissues was developed and used to overlay well-known morphological features with de novo characterization of lymphoid tissue architecture at a single-cell and cellular neighborhood levels.

title: Cytopathological image analysis using deep-learning networks in microfluidic microscopy
summary: deep-learning networks for cytopathologic analysis by performing the classification of three important unlabeled, unstained leukemia cell lines (K562, MOLT, and HL60)

title: Leishmaniasis parasite segmentation and classification using deep learning
summary: U-net model trained to segments leismania parasites and classifies them into promastigotes, amastigotes and adhered parasites

title: Convolutional neural networks for false positive reduction of automatically detected cilia in low magnification TEM images
summary: convolutional neural network classifier is proposed to further reduce the false positives detected by a previously presented template matching method

title: Nanoparticle detection from TEM images with deep learning [GEM görüntülerinden derin öǧrenme ile nanoparçacik tespiti]
summary: automatic detection of magnetite (Fe 3 O 4 ) particles on TEM images based on Convolutional Neural Networks

title: CDeep3M - Plug-and-Play cloud based deep learning for image segmentation of light  electron and X-ray microscopy
summary: ready-to-use image segmentation solution for any lab, with a pre-configured, publicly available, cloud-based deep convolutional neural network on Amazon Web Services

title: Automated Segmentation of Epithelial Tissue Using Cycle-Consistent Generative Adversarial Networks
summary: segmentation method based on cycle consistent generative adversarial networks, which can be trained even in absence of prepared image - mask pairs

title: Deep convolutional neural networks for segmenting 3D in vivo multiphoton   images of vasculature in Alzheimer disease mouse models
summary: explored the use of convolutional neural networks to segment 3D vessels within volumetric in vivo images

title: Super-resolution for asymmetric resolution of FIB-SEM 3D imaging using AI with deep learning
summary: we propose a new approach based on an image-processing or deep-learning-based method for super-resolution of 3D images with asymmetric resolution, so as to restore the depth resolution to achieve symmetric resolution

title: Performance of convolutional neural networks for identification of bacteria in 3D microscopy datasets
summary: 3D convolutional neural network to distinguish bacteria and non-bacterial objects in 3D light sheet fluorescence microscopy images of larval zebrafish intestines

title: Deep learning for isotropic super-resolution from non-isotropic 3d electron microscopy
summary: convolutional neural network architectures for image super-resolution in the context of 3D electron microscopy.

title: Real-time Image Processing for Microscopy-based Label-free Imaging Flow Cytometry in a Microfluidic Chip
summary: image-processing pipeline (R-MOD: Real-time Moving Object Detector) based on deep learning for high-throughput microscopy-based label-free IFC in a microfluidic chip.

title: Using Deep Learning for Segmentation and Counting within Microscopy Data
summary: incorporating uncertainty into the counting problem can improve model reliability and help identify possible failure cases for U2OS cells

title: Multicolor localization microscopy by deep learning
summary: demonstrate how deep learning can be used to design phase-modulating elements that, when implemented into the imaging path, result in further improved color differentiation between species

title: Nuclei detection and segmentation of fluorescence microscopy images using three dimensional convolutional neural networks
summary: A 3D method which can detect and segment nuclei in fluorescence microscopy images

title: Point-of-care mobile digital microscopy and deep learning for the detection of soil-transmitted helminths and Schistosoma haematobium
summary: deep learning-based image analysis can be utilized for the automated detection and classification of helminths in the captured images from mobile microscope

title: Sparse Autoencoder for Unsupervised Nucleus Detection and Representation in Histopathology Images
summary: sparse Convolutional Autoencoder (CAE) for fully unsupervised, simultaneous nucleus detection and feature extraction in histopathology tissue images

title: Cerebral vessels segmentation for light-sheet microscopy image using convolutional neural networks
summary: Adesses a problem of automatic and robust segmentation of cerebral micro-vessels structures in cerebrovascular images acquired by light-sheet microscope for mouse.

title: Deep and Wide Multiscale Recursive Networks for Robust Image Labeling
summary: Experiments in the challenging domain of connectomic reconstruction of neural circuity from 3d electron microscopy data show that these “Deep And Wide Multiscale Recursive” (DAWMR) networks lead to new levels of image labeling performance

title: Applying Faster R-CNN for Object Detection on Malaria Images
summary: object detection model previously used on natural images to identify cells and recognize their stages in brightfield microscopy images of malaria-infected blood

title: Automated classification of multiphoton microscopy images of ovarian tissue using deep learning
summary: multiphoton microscopy images from unstained, reproductive tissues can be robustly classified using deep learning techniques

title: Deep Fish: Deep Learningâ€“Based Classification of Zebrafish Deformation for High-Throughput Screening
summary: deep learning approach for accurate high-throughput classification of whole-body zebrafish deformations in multifish microwell plates.

title: Brain tumor classification of microscopy images using deep residual learning
summary: method to segment cell regions from astrocytes, robustly using BING objectness estimation and to classify brain tumors using deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) constructed by deep residual learning.

title: Resolution enhancement of wide-field interferometric microscopy by coupled deep autoencoders
summary: A deep-learning approach, based on coupled deep autoencoders, to improve resolution of images of L-shaped nanostructures.

title: Virus Particle Detection by Convolutional Neural Network in Transmission Electron Microscopy Images
summary: convolutional neural network that transforms a TEM image to a probabilistic map that indicates where virus particles exist in the image.

title: High-precision automated reconstruction of neurons with flood-filling networks
summary: flood-filling networks to trace neurons in a dataset obtained by serial block-face electron microscopy of a zebra finch brain

title: Convolutional neural networks in automatic recognition of trans-differentiated neural progenitor cells under bright-field microscopy
summary: novel recognition system based on convolutional neural networks, which could pre-process images and classify neural progenitor cells and non-neural progenitor cells

title: Transform- and multi-domain deep learning for single-frame rapid autofocusing in whole slide imaging
summary: investigate the autofocusing performance with three illumination settings: incoherent Kohler illumination, partially coherent illumination with two plane waves, and one-plane-wave illumination

title: Tox_(R)CNN: Deep Learning-Based Nuclei Profiling tool For Drug Toxicity Screening
summary: CNNs are trained to predict toxicity from images of DAPI-stained cells pre-treated with a set of drugs with differing toxicity mechanisms

title: Holographic deep learning for rapid optical screening of anthrax spores
summary: present an optical method for rapid and label-free screening of Bacillus anthracis spores through the synergistic application of holographic microscopy and deep learning

title: A pilot study for distinguishing chromophobe renal cell carcinoma and oncocytoma using second harmonic generation imaging and convolutional neural network analysis of collagen fibrillar structure
summary: examines a CNN model’s ability to differentiate between oncocytoma (benign), and chRCC (malignant) kidney tumor images acquired with second harmonic generation (SHG), which is very specific for collagen matrix. This is the first study that attempts to distinguish the two entities based on their collagen structure.

title: High-Content Analysis of Breast Cancer Using Single-Cell Deep Transfer Learning
summary: The input features of each cell are mapped to a particular MOA class without using any treatment-level profiles or feature reduction methods. This is is the first application of DNN in this domain, leveraging single-cell information. Furthermore, deep transfer learning (DTL) is used to alleviate the intensive and computational demanding effort of searching the huge parameter’s space of a DNN.

title: Segmentation of Glomeruli Within Trichrome Images Using Deep Learning
summary: developed an automated method to detect and segment the glomeruli within digitized kidney biopsy images by leveraging a deep learning architecture based on convolutional neural networks (CNN).

title: Microvasculature segmentation of arterioles using deep CNN
summary: utilize a deep convolutional neural network (CNN) framework for obtaining robust segmentations of microvasculature from epifluorescence microscopy imagery of mice dura mater

title: Hybrid deep learning for Reflectance Confocal Microscopy skin images
summary: Introduce a hybrid deep learning approach which uses traditional textonbased feature vectors as input to train a deep neural network. This hybrid method uses fixed filters in the input layer instead of tuned filters, yet superior performance is achieved.

title: Transfer learning with deep convolutional neural networks for classifying cellular morphological changes
summary: applied the pre-trained deep convolutional neural networks ResNet50, InceptionV3 and InceptionResnetV2 to predict cell mechanisms of action in response to chemical perturbations for two cell profiling datasets from the Broad Bioimage Benchmark Collection.

title: Deep convolutional neural networks for human embryonic cell counting
summary: propose a framework to automatically count the number of cells in developing human embryos. The framework employs a deep convolutional neural network model trained to count cells from raw microscopy images.

title: Multi-class segmentation of neuronal electron microscopy images using deep learning
summary: present a pixel-wise classification method based on Bayesian SegNet architecture. We carried out multi-class segmentation on serial section Transmission Electron Microscopy (ssTEM) images of Drosophila third instar larva ventral nerve cord, labeling the four classes of neuron membranes, neuron intracellular space, mitochondria and glia / extracellular space

title: Feature-Based Representation Improves Color Decomposition and Nuclear Detection Using a Convolutional Neural Network
summary: feature-based representation of the original image improves color decomposition (CD) and subsequent nuclear detection using convolutional neural networks independent of the imaging modality.

title: Deep Convolutional Neural Networks Enable Discrimination of Heterogeneous Digital Pathology Images
summary: a stand-alone pipeline to effectively classify different histopathology images across different types of cancer. In particular, we demonstrate the utility of our pipeline to discriminate between two subtypes of lung cancer, four biomarkers of bladder cancer, and five biomarkers of breast cancer. In addition, pipeline is applied to discriminate among four immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining scores of bladder and breast cancers.

title: Deep convolutional and recurrent neural networks for cell motility discrimination and prediction
summary: apply CNNs to classify different motility behaviors using two novel approaches. The first approach represents motility explicitly as a 3D space with markers denoting a cell’s location at each time point, and the second utilizes recurrent long-term short-term memory (LSTM) units to represent the temporal dimension implicitly. Both 3D CNNs and convolutional-recurrent neural networks (RNNs) provide accurate classification of simulated motility behaviors, the experimentally measured motility behaviors of multiple cell types, and characteristic motility behaviors of muscle stem cell differentiation states.

title: Fast, simple calcium imaging segmentation with fully convolutional networks
summary: Calcium imaging is a technique for observing neuron activity as a series of images showing indicator fluorescence over time. evaluated several deep learning models for ACIS on the Neurofinder competition datasets and report our best model: U-Net2DS, a fully convolutional network that operates on 2D mean summary images

title: A multiresolution deep learning framework for automated annotation of reflectance confocal microscopy images
summary: describe a new multiresolution “nested encoder-decoder” convolutional network architecture and use it to annotate morphological patterns in reflectance confocal microscopy (RCM) images of human skin for aiding cancer diagnosis.

title: Automated analysis of high-content microscopy data with deep learning
summary: Using a deep convolutional neural network (DeepLoc) to analyze yeast cell images, we show improved performance over traditional approaches in the automated classification of protein subcellular localization.

title: Classifying and segmenting microscopy images with deep multiple instance learning
summary: develop an approach that combines deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) with multiple instance learning (MIL) in order to classify and segment microscopy images using only whole image level annotations.

title: Nuclear Architecture Analysis of Prostate Cancer via Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: present an approach of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to identify prostate cancers. Prostate tissue specimen samples were obtained from the tissue microarrays and digitized. For each sample, epithelial nuclear seeds were identified and used to generate a nuclear seed map, i.e., only the location information of epithelial nuclei was utilized. From the nuclear seed maps, CNNs sought to learn the high-level feature representation of nuclear architecture and to detect cancers.

title: Multiclass Classification of Breast Cancer in Whole-Slide Images
summary: propose a deep learning-based framework that classifies H&E stained WSIs into regions of normal tissue, benign lesion, in-situ carcinoma and invasive carcinoma. The framework utilizes both microscopy images and WSIs to train a patch classifier in two stages

title: Structured illumination microscopy combined with machine learning enables the high throughput analysis and classification of virus structure
summary: approach on viruses produced for oncolytic viriotherapy (Newcastle Disease Virus) and vaccine development (Influenza). This unique tool enables the rapid assessment of the quality of viral production with high throughput obviating the need for complex and time consuming traditional batch testing methods

title: Stem cell detection based on Convolutional Neural Network via third harmonic generation microscopy images
summary: proposed a criterion of Computer-Aided Diagnosis (CAD) system to detect stem cells in the stratum basale based on cell segmentation algorithm and intrinsic characteristics of cells, which can provide consistent and accurate results for assisting the assessment of diagnosis.

title: Enhanced CNN based electron microscopy image segmentation
summary: proposes an approach using perceptual grouping via a graph cut and its combinations with Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to achieve improved segmentation of SEM images. Experimental results demonstrate improved computational efficiency with linear running time.

title: A Hierarchical Convolutional Neural Network for vesicle fusion event classification
summary: present a framework to automatically detect fusion events. First, an iterative searching algorithm is developed to extract image patch sequences containing potential events. Then, we propose an event image to integrate the critical image patches of a candidate event into a single-image joint representation as the input to Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).

title: Cell Dynamic Morphology Classification Using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: An application of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to mouse lymphocytes cell dynamic morphology classification

title: Deep Learning Segmentation of Optical Microscopy Images Improves 3-D Neuron Reconstruction
summary: proposed to use 3-D convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for segmenting the neuronal microscopy images. Specifically, we designed a novel CNN architecture, that takes volumetric images as the inputs and their voxel-wise segmentation maps as the outputs. The developed architecture allows us to train and predict using large microscopy images in an end-to-end manner

title: DLBI: Deep learning guided Bayesian inference for structure reconstruction of super-resolution fluorescence microscopy
summary: A simulator that takes a high-resolution image as the input, and simulates time-series low-resolution fluorescent images based on experimentally calibrated parameters, which provides supervised training data to the deep learning model. Then, a multi-scale deep learning module for capturing both spatial information in each input low-resolution image as well as temporal information among the time-series images. And the last one is a Bayesian inference module that takes the image from the deep learning module as the initial localization of fluorophores and removes artifacts by statistical inference.

title: A deep learning approach to estimate chemically-treated collagenous tissue nonlinear anisotropic stress-strain responses from microscopy images
summary: Deep Learning model was designed and trained to process second harmonic generation (SHG) images of collagen networks in GLBP tissue samples, and directly predict the tissue elastic mechanical properties.

title: Deep learning as a tool for increased accuracy and efficiency of histopathological diagnosis
summary: DL technique to improve the objectivity and efficiency of histopathologic slide analysis by identifying prostate cancer in biopsy specimens and breast cancer metastasis detection in sentinel lymph nodes. Demonstrate that DL techniques reduce the workload for pathologists, while at the same time increasing objectivity of diagnoses.

title: Fast 3D cell tracking with wide-field fluorescence microscopy through deep learning
summary: propose a CNN to retrieve the 3D locations of the fluorophores from a single 2D image captured by a conventional wide-field fluorescence microscope without any hardware modification. Method is robust enough to localize multiple objects across a much larger axial range

title: Automatic classification of light field smear microscopy patches using Convolutional Neural Networks for identifying Mycobacterium Tuberculosis
summary: a method for automatic classification of light field smear microscopy patches using RGB, R-G and grayscale patches versions as inputs of a Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) model for identifying mycobacterium tuberculosis

title: Learning unsupervised feature representations for single cell microscopy images with paired cell inpainting
summary: an unsupervised deep learning method that learns features for representing single cells in fluorescence microscopy image. Authors demonstrate that the features learned through their training task surpass other unsupervised feature sets in discriminating phenotypes for both yeast and human cells

title: A deep learning approach to identify local structures in   atomic-resolution transmission electron microscopy images
summary: deep learning-based algorithm for recognition of the local structure in TEM images, which is stable to microscope parameters and noise. The neural network is trained entirely from simulation but is capable of making reliable predictions on experimental images.

title: Combinatorial Energy Learning for Image Segmentation
summary: new machine learning approach for image segmentation that uses a CNN to model the conditional energy of a segmentation given an image

title: A hierarchical convolutional neural network for mitosis detection in phase-contrast microscopy images
summary: Hierarchical Convolution Neural Network (HCNN) for mitosis event detection in time-lapse phase contrast microscopy

title: Deep Learning Global Glomerulosclerosis in Transplant Kidney Frozen Sections
summary: development of a deep learning model that identifies and classifies non-sclerosed and sclerosed glomeruli in whole-slide images of donor kidney frozen section biopsies

title: Minimal annotation training for segmentation of microscopy images
summary: a CNN for segmentation of images with minimal annotation in a challenging transmission electron microscopy image dataset of viruses.

title: Deep convolutional encoder-decoder for myelin and axon segmentation
summary: Fully automatic method for segmenting myelin and axon from microscopy images of excised mouse spinal cord based on Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Deep Convolutional Encoder-Decoder

title: Structure-based assessment of cancerous mitochondria using deep networks
summary: deep learning-based approach to quantitatively assess the structure of mitochondria isolated from liver tumor cell lines using convolutional neural network (CNN)

title: Predicting cancer outcomes from histology and genomics using convolutional networks
summary: a computational approach for learning patient outcomes from digital pathology images using deep learning to combine the power of adaptive machine learning algorithms with traditional survival models

title: Center-Focusing Multi-task {CNN} with Injected Features for Classification of Glioma Nuclear Images
summary: Classifying the various shapes and attributes of a glioma cell nucleus

title: Predicting breast tumor proliferation from whole-slide images: the TUPAC16 challenge.

title: Label-free nuclear staining reconstruction in quantitative phase images using deep learning

title: Deep learning achieves super-resolution in fluorescence microscopy
summary: Utilized GANs to transform low-resolution images into high-resolution images

title: Edge Detection of Cryptic Lamellipodia Assisted by Deep Learning
summary: Combined conventional image analysis algorithms with CNNs to detect edges in time-lapse movies of collective cell migration.

title: vU-net: accurate cell edge segmentation in time-lapse fluorescence live cell images based on convolutional neural network
summary: Proposed vU-net, integrating a VGG-161 pretrained encoder and a U-net2 derived convolutional network to reconstruct cell edges in time-lapse imagery.

title: DeepPicker: A deep learning approach for fully automated particle picking in cryo-EM
summary: Particles from multiple molecular complexes are combined together in an iterative CNN based pipeline to capture common features of particles, thus improving classifications in each consituent target complex.

title: Multicell migration tracking within angiogenic networks by deep learning-based segmentation and augmented Bayesian filtering
summary: CNN based cell detection combined with backward Kalman filtering for tracking (incorporating prior knowledge on vessel formation and cell proliferation rates).

title: Accurate and high throughput cell segmentation method for mouse brain nuclei using cascaded convolutional neural network
summary: Proposed a cascading CNN approach to improve segmentation, whereby the probability map from one CNN is passed on as input to a subsequent CNN together with the original images.

title: Stem cell motion-tracking by using deep neural networks with multi-output
summary: Formulated a CNN with two output layers, one for mitosis detection and the other - connected to a particle filter based sampling scheme - for cell tracking.

title: Neural network control of focal position during time-lapse microscopy of cells
summary: Developed a CNN-based autofocus method for bright-field and phase-contrast microscopy.

title: Content-Aware Image Restoration: Pushing the Limits of Fluorescence Microscopy
summary: Utilized a U-Net architecture to perform a range of cell image restoration tasks.

title: Isotropic reconstruction of 3D fluorescence microscopy images using convolutional neural networks
summary: Used CNNs to restore isotropic image volumes from anisotropic light-optical acquisitions without the need for additional ground truth training data.

title: Deep-learning-based flexible pipeline for segmenting and tracking cells in 3D image time series for whole brain imaging
summary: Applied a 3D U-net architecture to classify pixels as cell or not-cell, follwed by manually corrected watershed cell segmentation, and tracking over space and time using a feed-forward network.

title: Combining deep learning and coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering imaging for automated differential diagnosis of lung cancer
slc: Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering Imaging O
summary: Classified lung cancer tissue using CNNs and transfer learning.

title: Deep Convolutional Neural Networks for Detecting Cellular Changes Due to Malignancy
summary: Compared CNN architectures (ResNet & VGG) for classifying oral and cervical cancer cells.

title: Deep residual Hough voting for mitotic cell detection in histopathology images
summary: Combined a ResNet architecture with Hough voting for mitotic cell detection.

title: Multi-channel deep transfer learning for nuclei segmentation in glioblastoma cell tissue images
summary: Applied a U-Net architecture combined with atrous spatial pyramid pooling and transfer learning for cell segmentation.

title: Unsupervised single-particle deep clustering via statistical manifold   learning
summary: Presents a manifold learning algorithm for unsupervised single-particle deep clustering.

title: Deep contextual residual network for electron microscopy image segmentation in connectomics
summary: Utilized a spatially efficient residual network with multilevel contextual cues for improved segmentation performance.

title: An effective fully deep convolutional neural networks for mitochondria segmentation based on ATUM-SEM
summary: Proposed a very deep FCN (fusing Resnet, PSPnet and Inception arcitectures) followed by a fully connected conditional random field for mitochondrial segmentation.

title: Effective automated pipeline for 3D reconstruction of synapses based on deep learning
summary: Adopts Faster Region Convolutional Neural Networks (Faster R-CNN) algorithm to detect synapses.

title: Beyond Classification: Structured Regression for Robust Cell Detection Using Convolutional Neural Network
summary: Proposes a CNN based architecture with a final structured regression layer to encode topological information for cell detection.

title: Microscopy cell counting and detection with fully convolutional regression networks
summary: Developed Fully Convolutional Regression Networks (FCRNs), estimating density maps, for cell counting and detection.

title: Deep Voting and Structured Regression for Microscopy Image Analysis
summary: Proposed: a CNN-based hough voting method to localize nucleus centroids accounting for voting confidence and; a CNN-based structured regression model to deal with overlapping cells.

title: A deep convolutional neural network for classification of red blood cells in sickle cell anemia
summary: Applied a CNN to classify red blood cells to extracted patch based images of individual cells.

title: Deep learning for high-throughput quantification of oligodendrocyte ensheathment: a UNet architecture to extract multiple morphological parameters from individual cells
summary: Employed a UNet architecture for myelin segmentation within cells.

title: A novel framework to integrate convolutional neural network with compressed sensing for cell detection
summary: Combined CNNs with compressed-sensing based output encoding for cell detection and localization.

title: BoxNet: Deep Learning Based Biomedical Image Segmentation Using Boxes Only Annotation
summary: Developed a method combining weakly supervised deep learning box annotation and grid search for locating object boundaries.

title: Automated red blood cells extraction from holographic images using fully convolutional neural networks
summary: Combined FCNs with marker-controlled watershed segmentation on red blood cells.

title: ssEMnet: Serial-section electron microscopy image registration using a spatial transformer network with learned features
summary: Combined a spatial transformer network and a convolutional autoencoder for image alignment.

title: Acral melanoma detection using a convolutional neural network for dermoscopy images
summary: Applied a CNN with transfer learning to dermoscopy images of acral melanoma.

title: Phenotypic Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing with Deep Learning Video Microscopy
summary: Videos of bacteria in urine were recorded over time and compressed into static images containing single cell features subsequently used in a DNN to determine pathogen concentrations.

title: Automated Melanoma Recognition in Dermoscopy Images via Very Deep Residual Networks
summary: Integrated a very deep (more than 50 layers) fully convolutional residual network (for segmentation) with another very deep residual networks (for classification).

title: Classify epithelium-stroma in histopathological images based on deep transferable network
summary: Presented a transfer learning based CNN with unsupervised domain adaptation for epitheliumstroma classification.

title: Automatic Skin Lesion Segmentation Using Deep Fully Convolutional Networks with Jaccard Distance
summary: Utilized CNNs with a Jaccard distance based loss function, to deal with imbalance between foreground and background pixels, for skin lesion segmentation.

title: AxonDeepSeg: Automatic axon and myelin segmentation from microscopy data using convolutional neural networks
summary: Introduced AxonDeepSeg, an open-source software that performs axon and myelin segmentation of microscopic images using a U-Net inspired architecture.

title: DeepPap: Deep Convolutional Networks for Cervical Cell Classification.
summary: Applied transfer learning and CNNs for cervical cell classification.

title: DeepEM3D: approaching human-level performance on 3D anisotropic EM image segmentation
summary: Proposed a hybrid 3D-2D fully convolutional architecture, accounting for anisotropy, for 3D neurite segmentation.

title: High-throughput high-resolution Generated Adversarial Network Microscopy
summary: Combined GANs with wide-field light images to generate their super-resolution counterparts under a large field of view.

title: Cell mitosis detection using deep neural networks
summary: Proposed a two stage network: (1) a fully convolutional network to detect potential mitosis events; (2) a 3D-CNN (time being the third dimension), to incorporate spatiotemporal information, and further discriminates candidates.

title: DeepNeuron: an open deep learning toolbox for neuron tracing
summary: Introduced DeepNeuron, with deep learning modules to solve various problems in neuron tracing, including detection under different image conditions, connecting neurons into trees, and dentrite and axon classification.

title: An Extended Type Cell Detection and Counting Method based on FCN
summary: Utilized a fully convolutional network for cell counting and detection.

title: A deep convolutional neural network approach to single-particle recognition in cryo-electron microscopy
summary: Used a recursively trained CNN for single-particle recognition from noisy cryo-EM micrographs.
